p: In this work, CuS/Cu 1.8S nanocomposites were firstly prepared simultaneously by the one-pot Synthesis method at a relatively high reaction temperature 200 °C. The CuS/Cu 1.8S nanocomposites anodes exhibited a high initial discharge capacity (1555 mAh g −1 at 100 mA g −1 and 1130 mAh g −1 at 267 mA g −1), excellent cycle stability at high current density (average 425 mAh g −1 at 267 mA g −1 during 1000 cycles), and remarkable reversible rate performance, which could be attributed to the nano-size of the CuS/Cu 1.8S nanocomposites and the assistance of Cu 1.8S. Though the more suitable ratio of CuS to Cu 1.8S needs to be further investigated, the high electrochemical performance of the CuS/Cu 1.8S nanocomposites indicated that the Cu xS nanomaterials will be a potential lithium-ion battery anode.
